title: Buffalo Grilled Shrimp with Blue Cheese Dip and Celery
summary: Buffalo Grilled Shrimp with Blue Cheese Dip and Celery might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains around 26g of protein, 20g of fat, and a total of 298 calories. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.87 per serving. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 40 minutes. If you have cheese, butter, jumbo shrimp, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sour cream you could follow this main course with the Sour Cream Apple Pie as a dessert. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 38%. This score is not so excellent. Try Salt-and-Pepper Buffalo Shrimp with Blue Cheese and Celery, Buffalo Grilled Shrimp with Blue Cheese Dip, and Buffalo Chicken Panini With Blue Cheese And Celery for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.

instructions: Preparation                                        Make dip:                  Stir together ingredients, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.                                                            Make shrimp:                 Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal (medium heat for gas); see Grilling Procedure. Toss shrimp with oil and 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Oil grill rack, then grill shrimp, covered only if using a gas grill, turning once, until just cooked through, 7 to 8 minutes total. Stir together butter and hot sauce in a large bowl. Add shrimp and toss until coated. Serve shrimp with dip and celery.                                                Cooks' note:              Shrimp can be cooked in an oiled hot 2-burner grill pan over medium heat.

steps.step: Stir together ingredients, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal (medium heat for gas); see Grilling Procedure. Toss shrimp with oil and 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Oil grill rack, then grill shrimp, covered only if using a gas grill, turning once, until just cooked through, 7 to 8 minutes total. Stir together butter and hot sauce in a large bowl.
Add shrimp and toss until coated.
Serve shrimp with dip and celery.
Shrimp can be cooked in an oiled hot 2-burner grill pan over medium heat.
